explosives.rationale: Cannot be classified due to lack of data on the kick-off temperature and decomposition energy (though the substance contains nitro groups, with its oxygen budget calculated at -153). Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#2783 (Organophosphorus Pesticide, solid, toxic) (ICSC,1999)) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "flammable" by ICSC (1999). Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#2783 (Organophosphorous Pesticide, solid, toxic) (ICSC,1999)) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

self_reactive_substances.rationale: No data available, though the substance contains chemical groups associated with explosive properties that contain nitro groups. Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#2783 (Organophosphorous Pesticide, solid, toxic) (ICSC,1999)) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#2783 (Organophosphorous Pesticide, solid, toxic) (ICSC,1999)) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available (melting point: 36degC (ICSC,1999), test temperature: 140degC).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: No data available, though being organic compounds containing oxygen bound to elements other than carbon and hydrogen. Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#2783 (Organophosphorous Pesticide, solid, toxic) (ICSC,1999)) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#2783 (Organophosphorous Pesticide, solid, toxic) (ICSC,1999)) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 24mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1987)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) value of 538mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1987)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "solid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 (4 hours) value of 0.0265mg/L, calculated from the testing data of rat LC50 (inhalation) of 0.106mg/L (1 hour) (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 4 (2005)).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit skin irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1988)): "The substance caused slight skin irritation which resolved within 72 hours."

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit eye irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1987)): The substance produced slight irritation of the conjunctiva, with effects fully resolving by day 7.

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitizer: Classification not possible Skin sensitizer: Not classified
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitizer: No data available Skin sensitizer: Based on no evidence of sensitization in guinea pig skin sensitization tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1987)).

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: When tested in vitro, the substance was negative in Ames tests, chromosome aberration tests and UDS tests on Hela cells, and positive in chromosome aberration tests on human lymphocytes and gene mutation tests on mouse lymphoma cells. When tested in vivo, the substance was negative in mouse micronucleus tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1987)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Available carcinogenicity studies in rats and mice provide no evidence of treatment-related increase in the incidence of tumor formation, reported in Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1989). Also due to the fact that the substance is classified as Category A4 by ACGIH (2003).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Based on the evidence of decreased viability of F1 and F2 on lactation day 4 at doses that caused parental toxicity in 2-generation reproductive toxicity studies in rats (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1988)).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence of "decreased locomotor activity, impairment of sensory functions and lethargy probably due to cholinesterase inhibition" from single dose studies with rats (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1994)). These effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence of "decreased locomotor activity, tremor, piloerection and abnormal gait probably due to cholinesterase inhibition" from repeated dose studies with rats (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1995)). These effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 4 days LC50=0.29microg/L of the crustacea (Pink Shrimp) (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 2, 2003).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since the acute toxicity was Category 1 and it had no rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 3% (Existing Chemicals Safety Check Data)), and it had the bio-accumulation (BCF=1590 (Existing Chemicals Safety Check Data)), it was classified into Category 1.
